abstract.text: A filled polygon with an optional stroked border.
Layer to use from a vector tile source.
The outline color of the fill. Matches the value of
if unspecified.

Name of image in sprite to use for drawing image fills. For seamless patterns, image width and height must be a factor of two (2, 4, 8, …, 512). Note that zoom-dependent expressions will be evaluated only at integer zoom levels.
Transition options for
The minimum zoom level for the layer. At zoom levels less than the minzoom, the layer will be hidden.

Specifies an uniform elevation in meters. Note: If the value is zero, the layer will be rendered on the ground. Non-zero values will elevate the layer from the sea level, which can cause it to be rendered below the terrain.
Default value: 0. Minimum value: 0.
Particle animation driven by textures such as wind maps.
Note! This is an experimental feature. It can be changed or removed in future versions.
Sorts features in ascending order based on this value. Features with a higher sort key will appear above features with a lower sort key.
Name of a source description to be used for this layer.
Required for all layer types except

Transition options for
Selects the base of fill-elevation. Some modes might require precomputed elevation data in the tileset.
Default value: “none”.

Name of image in sprite to use for drawing image fills. For seamless patterns, image width and height must be a factor of two (2, 4, 8, …, 512). Note that zoom-dependent expressions will be evaluated only at integer zoom levels.
The geometry’s offset. Values are [x, y] where negatives indicate left and up, respectively.
Default value: [0,0]. The unit of fillTranslate is in pixels.
Location Indicator layer.
Transition options for
The opacity of the entire fill layer. In contrast to the
, this value will also affect the 1px stroke around the fill, if the stroke is used.
Default value: 1. Value range: [0, 1]
The color of the filled part of this layer. This color can be specified as
with an alpha component and the color’s opacity will not affect the opacity of the 1px stroke, if it is used.
Default value: “#000000”.
The background color or pattern of the map.
A protocol describing a style-related entity that can be decoded.
Sorts features in ascending order based on this value. Features with a higher sort key will appear above features with a lower sort key.
A style’s fog property is a global effect that improves depth perception by fading out distant objects.

Specifies an uniform elevation in meters. Note: If the value is zero, the layer will be rendered on the ground. Non-zero values will elevate the layer from the sea level, which can cause it to be rendered below the terrain.
Default value: 0. Minimum value: 0.
Whether or not the fill should be antialiased.
Default value: true.

Selects the base of fill-elevation. Some modes might require precomputed elevation data in the tileset.
Default value: “none”.
This property defines whether the
uses colorTheme from the style or not.
By default it will use color defined by the root theme in the style.
Selects the base of fill-elevation. Some modes might require precomputed elevation data in the tileset.
Default value: “none”.
The opacity of the entire fill layer. In contrast to the
, this value will also affect the 1px stroke around the fill, if the stroke is used.
Default value: 1. Value range: [0, 1]

Name of image in sprite to use for drawing image fills. For seamless patterns, image width and height must be a factor of two (2, 4, 8, …, 512). Note that zoom-dependent expressions will be evaluated only at integer zoom levels.
Whether or not the fill should be antialiased.
Default value: true.

The maximum zoom level for the layer. At zoom levels equal to or greater than the maxzoom, the layer will be hidden.
A spherical dome around the map that is always rendered behind all other layers.
Warning: As of v10.6.0,
is the preferred method for atmospheric styling. Sky layer is not supported by the globe projection, and will be phased out in future major release.
A protocol used to create any type of  map style content, such as layers, sources, lighting and others.
Layer that removes 3D content from map.

The slot this layer is assigned to.
If specified, and a slot with that name exists, it will be placed at that position in the layer order.
An icon or a text label.
Whether or not the fill should be antialiased.
Default value: true.
A pre-specified location in the style where layer will be added to
(such as on top of existing land layers, but below all labels).
Sorts features in ascending order based on this value. Features with a higher sort key will appear above features with a lower sort key.
Controls the intensity of light emitted on the source features.
Default value: 0. Minimum value: 0. The unit of fillEmissiveStrength is in intensity.
Client-side hillshading visualization based on DEM data. Currently, the implementation only supports Mapbox Terrain RGB and Mapzen Terrarium tiles.
